Comment: This command info is generated from fig
Name: diff

Arguments.Name: -i
Arguments.Description: Ignore case differences in file contents

Arguments.Name: --ignore-file-name-case
Arguments.Description: Ignore case when comparing file names

Arguments.Name: --no-ignore-file-name-case
Arguments.Description: Consider case when comparing file names

Arguments.Name: -E
Arguments.Description: Ignore changes due to tab expansion

Arguments.Name: -b
Arguments.Description: Ignore changes in the amount of white space

Arguments.Name: -w
Arguments.Description: Ignore all white space

Arguments.Name: -B
Arguments.Description: Ignore changes whose lines are all blank

Arguments.Name: -I
Arguments.Description: Ignore changes whose lines all match RE

Arguments.Name: RE
Arguments.Description: RE

Arguments.Name: --strip-trailing-cr
Arguments.Description: Strip trailing carriage return on input

Arguments.Name: -a
Arguments.Description: Treat all files as text

Arguments.Name: -c
Arguments.Description: Output NUM lines of copied context

Arguments.Name: NUM
Arguments.Description: NUM

Arguments.Name: -u
Arguments.Description: Output NUM lines of unified context

Arguments.Name: NUM
Arguments.Description: NUM

Arguments.Name: --label
Arguments.Description: Use LABEL instead of file name

Arguments.Name: LABEL
Arguments.Description: LABEL

Arguments.Name: -p
Arguments.Description: Show which C function each change is in

Arguments.Name: -F
Arguments.Description: Show the most recent line matching RE

Arguments.Name: RE
Arguments.Description: RE

Arguments.Name: -q
Arguments.Description: Output only whether files differ

Arguments.Name: -e
Arguments.Description: Output an ed script

Arguments.Name: --normal
Arguments.Description: Output a normal diff

Arguments.Name: -n
Arguments.Description: Output an RCS format diff

Arguments.Name: -y
Arguments.Description: Output in two columns

Arguments.Name: -W
Arguments.Description: Output at most NUM (default 130) print columns

Arguments.Name: NUM
Arguments.Description: NUM

Arguments.Name: --left-column
Arguments.Description: Output only the left column of common lines

Arguments.Name: --suppress-common-lines
Arguments.Description: Do not output common lines

Arguments.Name: -D
Arguments.Description: Output merged file to show `#ifdef NAME' diffs

Arguments.Name: NAME
Arguments.Description: NAME

Arguments.Name: -l
Arguments.Description: Pass the output through `pr' to paginate it

Arguments.Name: -t
Arguments.Description: Expand tabs to spaces in output

Arguments.Name: -T
Arguments.Description: Make tabs line up by prepending a tab

Arguments.Name: -r
Arguments.Description: Recursively compare any subdirectories found

Arguments.Name: -N
Arguments.Description: Treat absent files as empty

Arguments.Name: --unidirectional-new-file
Arguments.Description: Treat absent first files as empty

Arguments.Name: -s
Arguments.Description: Report when two files are the same

Arguments.Name: -x
Arguments.Description: Exclude files that match PAT

Arguments.Name: PAT
Arguments.Description: PAT

Arguments.Name: -X
Arguments.Description: Exclude files that match any pattern in FILE

Arguments.Name: FILE
Arguments.Description: FILE

Arguments.Name: -S
Arguments.Description: Start with FILE when comparing directories

Arguments.Name: FILE
Arguments.Description: FILE

Arguments.Name: --from-file
Arguments.Description: Compare FILE1 to all operands. FILE1 can be a directory

Arguments.Description: FILE1

Arguments.Name: --to-file
Arguments.Description: Compare all operands to FILE2. FILE2 can be a directory

Arguments.Description: FILE2

Arguments.Name: --horizon-lines
Arguments.Description: Keep NUM lines of the common prefix and suffix

Arguments.Name: NUM
Arguments.Description: NUM

Arguments.Name: -d
Arguments.Description: Try hard to find a smaller set of changes

Arguments.Name: --speed-large-files
Arguments.Description: Assume large files and many scattered small changes

Arguments.Description: Output version info
